div1.head: Jim to Mlle. Marcelle Guerin March 9th 1916
div1.p: Your very welcome letter of the 6th I received this noon. You’re a peach Marcelle — a dear to write me as you do. I wish I had more time to write to you for its one of my great pleasures.

Yes I’m slated for the Nieufort all right — if I don’t do again as I did to day. Vidart told me I would pass from the Moran to morrow and to make a short trip as
a wind up. On landing I over — reached and came sailing in just missing two machines. I was called down and told to go again. That time I saw I was getting near and tho [sic] I had nearly reached the ground I decided to put on the motor again and make another try. I did not look to the right or left for an outlet I could have veered to but kept straight ahead. I looked suddenly upward. My God there were the trees
bordering the road. There was nothing left to do but to try and get over them — but I was so close. I pulled on the machine and shot up — a thing one is forbidden to do because of the danger. The trees were coming closer and they were always above me. I was very close now and saw the top of one just in front. "Good night" said I and wondered where I’d crash down. Then I wondered why the wheels didn’t touch and pitch me forward.
Then I knew I had crossed them and was going up to a safe altitude. I caught the devil on coming down. I had missed the tree top by fifty centimeters. Now I'll have to stay on the Moran a couple of days longer, even tho [sic] I did make another trip, a perfect atterrissage, and Vidart said I was once more "Mon bon Mac Connell"

Yes the Nieufort is what I’ve always wanted. The only trouble is that they make one go through so much training that I’ll be longer getting to the front. I do not want to go in
the American crowd, but may have to.

Rumsey finally showed up. He has been given fifteen days jail in the infantry prison of Pau. He may be able to save himself because of Prince’s pull with the Captain. He has eight days dalle de police in addition because a man stole his snow boots and he cannot account for them.

I inclose [sic] the photos.
Lord but that’s the limit that your father chanced to run into us as we were getting into the taxi. Of course he’s figured it out as well as your mother, but its fine of you to hide it as you have Marcelle.

By the way would you rather have me address letters to you at the Ambulance? If I’m taboo with your father and mother maybe it might embarrass you to have my letters go to
your home.

closer.salute:
Well, good night dear and remember me make me very happy by writing.
More anon
